TextView.android:text: The integral of a function can be geometrically interpreted as the area under the curve of the mathematical function f(x) plotted as a function of x. You can see yourself drawing a large number of blocks to appproximate the area under a complex curve, getting a better answer if you use more blocks. The integral gives you a mathematical way of drawing an infinite number of blocks and getting a precise analytical expression for the area. That's very important for geometry - and profoundly important for the physical sciences where the definitions of many physical entities can be cast in a mathematical form like the area under a curve.
